strIntroduction: Spend the day exploring the cultural sights at Fo Guang Shan including the huge Buddha statue and tranquil Cheng Ching Lake Visit Fo Guang Shan Buddhist Memorial Centre, home to some of the relics of Gautama Buddha and a colossal, unforgettable Buddha statue Explore the bustling stalls surrounding Fo Guang Shan, abundant in traditional souvenirs and religious trinkets Enjoy a relaxing afternoon at Cheng Ching Lake, and walk across the Bridge of Nine Turns Enjoy convenient hotel transfers, plus insurance and mineral water included in the tour Visit Fo Guang Shan Buddhist Memorial Centre, home to some of the relics of Gautama Buddha and a colossal, unforgettable Buddha statue Visit Fo Guang Shan Buddhist Memorial Centre, home to some of the relics of Gautama Buddha and a colossal, unforgettable Buddha statue Explore the bustling stalls surrounding Fo Guang Shan, abundant in traditional souvenirs and religious trinkets Explore the bustling stalls surrounding Fo Guang Shan, abundant in traditional souvenirs and religious trinkets Enjoy a relaxing afternoon at Cheng Ching Lake, and walk across the Bridge of Nine Turns Enjoy a relaxing afternoon at Cheng Ching Lake, and walk across the Bridge of Nine Turns Enjoy convenient hotel transfers, plus insurance and mineral water included in the tour Enjoy convenient hotel transfers, plus insurance and mineral water included in the tour What We Love:   What We Love: As one of the most venerated Buddhist sites in Taiwan, the Fo Guang Shan Buddhish Memorial Centre cannot be missed. You are greeted by a colossal Buddha statue upon climbing the stairs towards the centre. One of the most fascinating aspects of Fo Guang Shan is that it is home to a relic of Gautama Buddha, the founder of the Buddhist faith. On leaving the temple, the surrounding cluster of lively stalls selling souvenirs and scriptures is well worth a roam. After an afternoon at Fo Guang Shan, cool off by the Cheng Ching Lake, with scenic sights all around such as the chateau of one of Taiwan's former presidents that looks over the waters, and Phu Quoc Island situated within the lake. Make sure to walk across the Bridge of Nine Turns to get breathtaking views of Cheng Ching Lake and its surroundings.
strTitle: Fo Guang Shan and Cheng Ching Lake

strIntroduction: Discover Hakka and aboriginal culture on a day trip through Meinong and Taiwan Indigenous Culture Park Learn about Hakka culture by visiting Meinong Township and its many sights, such as East Gate Tower and Literature Pavilions Sample some Hakka specialties, such as flat noodles, stewed winter lemon and wild lotus Visit Taiwan Indigenous Culture Park, a beautiful and natural area that preserves the history of aboriginal culture Hotel pick up and drop off, insurance and mineral water are all included Learn about Hakka culture by visiting Meinong Township and its many sights, such as East Gate Tower and Literature Pavilions Learn about Hakka culture by visiting Meinong Township and its many sights, such as East Gate Tower and Literature Pavilions Sample some Hakka specialties, such as flat noodles, stewed winter lemon and wild lotus Sample some Hakka specialties, such as flat noodles, stewed winter lemon and wild lotus Visit Taiwan Indigenous Culture Park, a beautiful and natural area that preserves the history of aboriginal culture Visit Taiwan Indigenous Culture Park, a beautiful and natural area that preserves the history of aboriginal culture Hotel pick up and drop off, insurance and mineral water are all included Hotel pick up and drop off, insurance and mineral water are all included What We Love:   What We Love: Learn about two fascinating and unique cultures in this full day tour. Start off at Meinong, home to Hakka culture, and well preserved through landmarks such as the illustrious East Gate Tower and Literature Pavilions. To really get a feel of the Hakka lifestyle, venture into the Meinong Folk Village, and try the delicious local delicacies such as flat noodles and stewed winter melon. Next, visit Taiwan Indigenous Culture Park, which plays host to a cluster of aboriginal villages. With no modern establishments in sight, and nature all around, the park is the perfect place to discover some inner peace, as well as learn about the extraordinary aboriginal culture firsthand by visiting the park's many tribal cabins, which house aboriginal handicrafts and wax works. Or simply stroll around the park to bask in the beautiful, natural environment.

Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Draped in history and influences from across the world, this tour takes you deeper into Tainan's heritage, history and industry. Visit the Eternal Golden Castle, a fortification against the Japanese completed in 1876 in the western style and restored to its original glory. See the beautiful and well-preserved Merchant house of Tait & Co., evidence of a thriving foreign trade before the Japanese occupation, and the Tree House (an old warehouse) behind. Taste Tainan's famed snacks (reputedly the best in Taiwan) before heading to the huge Wushantou Reservoir, an area of immense beauty and historical significance. Finish at Xinhua Old Street, lined with Baroque-style facades and Japanese-era shop fronts.

Explore the lively, bustling port city of Kaohsiung on this evening tour Witness awe-inspiring views of the Kaohsiung Harbor at the British Consulate Residence Cruise down the Love River, with plenty of sights lined across the river banks Treat yourself to some fresh seafood and traditional souvenirs at Liouhe Night Market Tour is inclusive of hotel transfers, insurance and mineral water Witness awe-inspiring views of the Kaohsiung Harbor at the British Consulate Residence Witness awe-inspiring views of the Kaohsiung Harbor at the British Consulate Residence Cruise down the Love River, with plenty of sights lined across the river banks Cruise down the Love River, with plenty of sights lined across the river banks Treat yourself to some fresh seafood and traditional souvenirs at Liouhe Night Market Treat yourself to some fresh seafood and traditional souvenirs at Liouhe Night Market Tour is inclusive of hotel transfers, insurance and mineral water Tour is inclusive of hotel transfers, insurance and mineral water What We Love:   What We Love: The Kaohsiung Night Tour comprises of three main locations, each with a unique vibe of its own; the first stop is the British Consulate Residence, sitting atop a hill and providing visitors with breathtaking views of Kaohsiung Harbor and its surrounding area. You will then cruise down Love River, which is lined with parks as well as some of the city's most treasured landmarks, such as the Holy Rosary Cathedral. After the boat ride, indulge in delicious seafood, as well as all kinds of traditional handicrafts and clothing at the Liouhe Night Market, which marks the end of the tour.

second largest city in Taiwan, Kaohsiung is a bustling place, with an intriguing blend of old and new. This tour showcases exactly that; the old is reflected in the visit to Qijin Island, which houses the Qihou Lighthouse, a white baroque-style Japanese construction, which contrasts with Qihou Fort, a Chinese-style monument. For a taste of contemporary Taiwan, head over to Pier2 Art Center, an old warehouse converted into a creative hub for the city's modern artists. Witness some of the most panaromic views that Kaohsiung has to offer at the British Consulate Residence, as well as from the boat ride down the Love River, arguably the most preferred way to view the city by night. End your Kaoshiung experience at the Gold Diamond Kai-Shuan Night Market, the largest market in the area, famed for its trademark papaya milkshakes and succulent steamed shrimp.

Witness Tainan's most revered cultural and historical landmarks in a night tour of the city Walk around Fort Provintia, an old Dutch fort, surrounded by peaceful and picturesque gardens Marvel at the religious iconography at Xiaonan City God Temple, one of the most frequented temples in the city Witness several interesting collections of artifacts at the Five Channels Harbor District Regional Cultural Museum Enjoy hotel pickup and dinner, included in the tour package Walk around Fort Provintia, an old Dutch fort, surrounded by peaceful and picturesque gardens Walk around Fort Provintia, an old Dutch fort, surrounded by peaceful and picturesque gardens Marvel at the religious iconography at Xiaonan City God Temple, one of the most frequented temples in the city Marvel at the religious iconography at Xiaonan City God Temple, one of the most frequented temples in the city Witness several interesting collections of artifacts at the Five Channels Harbor District Regional Cultural Museum Witness several interesting collections of artifacts at the Five Channels Harbor District Regional Cultural Museum Enjoy hotel pickup and dinner, included in the tour package Enjoy hotel pickup and dinner, included in the tour package What We Love:   What We Love: As the oldest city in Taiwan, Tainan is a haven for history buffs, with plenty of intriguing landmarks, dedicated to culture and religion. This night tour takes you to three of the most revered sites of Tainan; after dinner, you will first be taken to Fort Provinitia, also known as Chickan Towers, which contains softly-lit Chinese-style towers built upon a Dutch fort surrounded by a picturesque Japanese garden, complete with a koi fish pond. Known to be one of the prettiest sites in Tainan, Fort Provintia is an excellent way to start your tour, which then takes you to Xiaonan City God Temple, an elaborate structure adorned with hundreds of images of soldiers and dragons. Finally, you can view some folk artefacts at the Five Channels Harbor District Regional Cultural Museum; built upon an area that was once Tainan's business centre, the museum itself has a history as inspiring as the collections contained inside.

Complete your afternoon with a delectable tea break at Salex cafe as you gaze over those beautiful lake views.

Locals flock to the harbour daily for the fresh seafood delicacies featuring local speciality dishes and unique cooking approaches. On the tour you'll have the chance to experience the spectacular ocean views of Nanfang'ao and Neipi Beach, visit the Fisherfolk Culture Museum, see the Nanning Fish Market in action and chow down on a local rice and mackerel dinner as an appropriate finish to your day.

Under the skilful lead of a professional guide, you'll get an true nature experience hiking and camping at the ethereal Chia Lo Lake Hike through huge ancient trees and dense forest to discover one of Yilan's most beautiful lakes Camp at a mountain lodge beside the peaceful lake and wake to see the fog floating on the surface of the lake in the cool morning Soak up the nighttime beauty where thousands of twinkling stars will be clearly visible at night Accompanied by professional and experienced guide, learn about the area's history, topography, astronomy and wildlife Your evening meal and second day breakfast plus a sleeping bag are prepared for you Hike through huge ancient trees and dense forest to discover one of Yilan's most beautiful lakes Camp at a mountain lodge beside the peaceful lake and wake to see the fog floating on the surface of the lake in the cool morning Soak up the nighttime beauty where thousands of twinkling stars will be clearly visible at night Accompanied by professional and experienced guide, learn about the area's history, topography, astronomy and wildlife Your evening meal and second day breakfast plus a sleeping bag are prepared for you What We Love:   What We Love: Throughout this two day one night experience, you'll stay at a mountain house and be accompanied by an expert camping guide who will take command of the campsite. All food, sleeping bags and camping gear is provided and prepared so you can take the time to appreciate Chia Lo Lake where, legend goes, a fairy spilt a pearl necklace scattering the pearls across the land and creating the mirror-like reflections of these lakes. Each morning an ethereal fog floats above the lake whilst at night you'll be able to see a map of stars twinkling above you. It might be just a short journey from the city, but just a few hours of hiking and you'll feel like you're in a different world - the perfect nature escape from Taipei.

strIntroduction: Nature lovers get ready – for Taiwan's stunning Taroko Gorge. Roaring rivers, tranquil mountain shrines, canyon suspension bridges and scenic beaches await at this beautiful National Park Venture along the Swallows' Grotto Trail for the most dramatic view of the gorge Get lunch at Tianxiang and visit the town's iconic red suspension bridge Visit the eternal springs at Changchun Shrine, burrowed into the hillside Take in the ocean air at Qixingtan and the pebble stone beach or find peace in the tranquil plains of Buluowan tribal village Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off and optional lunch Venture along the Swallows' Grotto Trail for the most dramatic view of the gorge Venture along the Swallows' Grotto Trail for the most dramatic view of the gorge Get lunch at Tianxiang and visit the town's iconic red suspension bridge Get lunch at Tianxiang and visit the town's iconic red suspension bridge Visit the eternal springs at Changchun Shrine, burrowed into the hillside Visit the eternal springs at Changchun Shrine, burrowed into the hillside Take in the ocean air at Qixingtan and the pebble stone beach or find peace in the tranquil plains of Buluowan tribal village Take in the ocean air at Qixingtan and the pebble stone beach or find peace in the tranquil plains of Buluowan tribal village Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off and optional lunch Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off and optional lunch What We Love:   What We Love: Take a private day tour to what is arguably Taiwan's most scenic destination, Taroko National Park. Showcasing a diverse range of nature and wildlife: travel from rugged coast, to luscious forest, to the dramatic cliff faces of 19km Taroko Gorge. Delve into the heart of the park at the Swallow Grotto Trail, interspersed with tunnels and the best viewpoint for overlooking the narrowest part of the gorge, where the river is at its most dramatic. After lunch in scenic Tianxiang, you'll visit the Changchung Shrine (or the Eternal Spring Shrine), a beautiful temple nestled within the hillside, atop a waterfall stream that supposedly never stops running (hence the name of the shrine). Before ending at Qixingtan, famed for its pebble beach and fantastic views of the Pacific Ocean.

The varied route will have you transitioning between paddling ferociously, holding tight as you plunge down a rapid and sitting back to appreciate the spectacular scenery you're passing through. You'll journey through rocky ravines with a backdrop of impressive mountainous scenery before ending on the coast of the Pacific Ocean. Take your pick of raft types for varying degrees of comfort and excitement! Run by a company with years of experience and led by a friendly professional instructor, safety is paramount—but they don't skimp on the fun!

strIntroduction: With possible sightings of 29 different species of cetaceans (whales and dolphins), chances are high for a fantastic marine display off Taiwan's east coast Sight a range of whale species including humpback, killer, sperm, false killer and pygmy killer whales Watch playful dolphins of species such as spinner, bottlenose, pantropical spotted and Chinese white dolphins Enjoy the guidance of a local fisherman to the best whale and dolphin sighting spots Relax and enjoy a delicious lunch included in the tour Ruisui and Hualien pick up available, please contact us for quotes Sight a range of whale species including humpback, killer, sperm, false killer and pygmy killer whales Sight a range of whale species including humpback, killer, sperm, false killer and pygmy killer whales Watch playful dolphins of species such as spinner, bottlenose, pantropical spotted and Chinese white dolphins Watch playful dolphins of species such as spinner, bottlenose, pantropical spotted and Chinese white dolphins Enjoy the guidance of a local fisherman to the best whale and dolphin sighting spots Enjoy the guidance of a local fisherman to the best whale and dolphin sighting spots Relax and enjoy a delicious lunch included in the tour Relax and enjoy a delicious lunch included in the tour Ruisui and Hualien pick up available, please contact us for quotes Ruisui and Hualien pick up available, please contact us for quotes What We Love:   What We Love: Home to 29 species of cetaceans (whales and dolphins) - an even more impressive fact when you realize there are only 60 species in the world – it's no wonder Taiwan's waters are a fantastic whale watching location. Cruise along the east coast in the hope of sighting a number of whale species including killer whales, humpback whales and sperm whales. Spot a tail splashing into the sea, watch them launch themselves out of the water or send jets from their blowholes. Not to mention the abundance of dolphins you're sure to sight. With everything from bottlenose, Chinese white, spinner and Risso's dolphins which dance in and out of the waves in large groups just feet from your boat. Watch these incredible creatures with the beautiful cliff coastline as your backdrop - it's a truly magical sight to behold!

strIntroduction: Test your hand-eye coordination with an evening of shrimp catching, followed by a scrumptious and social BBQ feast Learn about shrimp catching, right before you give it a go for yourself Cook your own shrimp at the nearby BBQ pits Enjoy a BBQ party, with guests to mingle with, and refreshments provided Learn about shrimp catching, right before you give it a go for yourself Learn about shrimp catching, right before you give it a go for yourself Cook your own shrimp at the nearby BBQ pits Cook your own shrimp at the nearby BBQ pits Enjoy a BBQ party, with guests to mingle with, and refreshments provided Enjoy a BBQ party, with guests to mingle with, and refreshments provided What We Love:   What We Love: Catch your own dinner and cook it too! After a brief introduction to shrimp catching, it's then your turn to don your headlamp, plunge your own net into the water and catch some delicious shrimp. Don't be fooled – shrimp fishing requires speedy reactions! You can then cook and taste your efforts at a fun barbecue party with optional grilled meat extras for the ultimate barbecue. You'll also have the chance to meet and mingle with locals and travelers. As utensils and ingredients are all ready and prepared, you won't have to worry about bringing anything other than your passion for shrimp catching and cooking!

Discover the true beauty of Hualien's inland nature and gain an insight into the former thriving industries created as a result of the Japanese occupation Explore Hualien's logging heritage at Lintian Mountain Forestry Center Visit Butterfly Valley at the Fuyuan National Forest Recreation Area in spectacular nature surrounds Get your sugar fix by sampling ice creams at the Hualien Sugar Factory Enjoy a tasty lunch and freshly produced milk tasting included in the tour Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Explore Hualien's logging heritage at Lintian Mountain Forestry Center Explore Hualien's logging heritage at Lintian Mountain Forestry Center Visit Butterfly Valley at the Fuyuan National Forest Recreation Area in spectacular nature surrounds Visit Butterfly Valley at the Fuyuan National Forest Recreation Area in spectacular nature surrounds Get your sugar fix by sampling ice creams at the Hualien Sugar Factory Get your sugar fix by sampling ice creams at the Hualien Sugar Factory Enjoy a tasty lunch and freshly produced milk tasting included in the tour Enjoy a tasty lunch and freshly produced milk tasting included in the tour Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Begin at Lintian Mountain Forestry Center, a once thriving logging town in lush mountain surrounds that has fallen into abandonment in recent years, but which remains a fascinating place to see the traces of a thriving Chinese cypress lumber industry: disused machinery and tools, an old timber railway and Japanese-style architecture from the days of occupation. Continue to the Butterfly Valley where over 30 of the colorful creatures flit between camphor trees, waterfalls, steep valleys and magnificent views. A delicious lunch is provided then a chance to taste the freshest high-quality milk as you sit outdoors at Ruisui Pasture. The tour ends on a sweet note, with a visit to Hualien Sugar Factory. A popular stop to sample all manner of flavored popsicles and ice cream and to visit the neat rows of Japanese-style bungalows built for workers during the Japanese occupation.

For a day of fun (and some environmental education too), bring the family to explore the acres of land used for eco-farming, an animal zoo, an aviary and even a pool and hot springs Learn more about cow farming and even watch a milking demonstration Kids will love the petting zoo, ponies and kids playing areas Rent bikes or an electric car to explore the resort with environmental-friendly ease Relax at the end of the day in the hot springs or swimming pool (extra cost) Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Learn more about cow farming and even watch a milking demonstration Learn more about cow farming and even watch a milking demonstration Kids will love the petting zoo, ponies and kids playing areas Kids will love the petting zoo, ponies and kids playing areas Rent bikes or an electric car to explore the resort with environmental-friendly ease Rent bikes or an electric car to explore the resort with environmental-friendly ease Relax at the end of the day in the hot springs or swimming pool (extra cost) Relax at the end of the day in the hot springs or swimming pool (extra cost) Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Demonstrating that eco-living is well within our reach and promoting farming and dairy culture, the Shin Kong Chao Feng Ranch & Resort is an ideal family day out – and great for giving the kids some environmental education. This incredible ecological park in the heart of Hualien and surrounded by spectacular mountain views, is jam-packed with activities to entertain. Take a stroll through the European-style landscaped garden or visit the Dutch windmill and flower gardens. Roam the 70 hectares of pastureland and say hello to the calves at the cow nursery. Help out with raccoon feeding time, pet the rabbits or walk through the birds of paradise aviary. You can navigate the huge park with an eco-friendly transport option by renting a bike or electric car, or by hopping aboard the passenger train. Then, at the end of an active day, relax in the hot springs whilst the kids splash about in the swimming pool.
strTitle: Shin Kong Chao Feng Ranch & Eco-Resort

strIntroduction: A theme park with a difference – Farglory Ocean Park provides visitors with not only exciting attractions but also excellent shows themed on marine ecology Get the best of a marine park and a theme park in one 51-hectare location Ride exciting rollercoasters, flume rides and other awesome attractions Watch marine-theme shows and visit the impressive aquarium Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Get the best of a marine park and a theme park in one 51-hectare location Get the best of a marine park and a theme park in one 51-hectare location Ride exciting rollercoasters, flume rides and other awesome attractions Ride exciting rollercoasters, flume rides and other awesome attractions Watch marine-theme shows and visit the impressive aquarium Watch marine-theme shows and visit the impressive aquarium Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Entertain the whole family at Taiwan's first theme- and nature-park hybrid. Farglory Ocean Park offers visitors an exciting selection of rides and shows with a focus on marine ecology. Must-see attractions include the widely acclaimed Dolphin and Sea Lion shows and the impressive aquarium. Thrill-seekers should head for the rollercoaster and flume ride or indoors to watch the incredible dance and acrobatics show. Rise to the skies of the ferris wheel or cable car for spectacular views across the Pacific Ocean. Then bring things back to earth in time for the park's carnivalesque parade. With the backdrop of the castle-like hotel and in tropical nature surrounds, this park is a veritable wonderland for a thrill-filled family day out.

Discover evidence of Japanese culture alongside modern Taiwanese creativity in this tour of Hualien's unique eastern coast See the only Grade III historic site on Taiwan's East Coast: Jian Chinxiu Temple Visit Hualien's Creative and Cultural Park, a hub for modern creatives in a renovated industrial setting Pause for thought at some of Taiwan's most beautiful lakes and stunning scenery Get a personalized service with your private English-speaking tour guide Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off See the only Grade III historic site on Taiwan's East Coast: Jian Chinxiu Temple See the only Grade III historic site on Taiwan's East Coast: Jian Chinxiu Temple Visit Hualien's Creative and Cultural Park, a hub for modern creatives in a renovated industrial setting Visit Hualien's Creative and Cultural Park, a hub for modern creatives in a renovated industrial setting Pause for thought at some of Taiwan's most beautiful lakes and stunning scenery Pause for thought at some of Taiwan's most beautiful lakes and stunning scenery Get a personalized service with your private English-speaking tour guide Get a personalized service with your private English-speaking tour guide Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: During the Japanese occupation, the influx of Japanese immigrants was particularly great in the Hualien area, a period of history that is still very much in evidence today. This half-day tour takes you on a journey to discover these touches of Japanese style and architecture, which have created a beautiful fusion of heritage, unique to the east coast. Begin at Jian Chinxiu Temple, a traditional Japanese Takono-style temple built for the large number of Japanese in the area in 1917. Onwards to Liyu Lake where, on a clear day, the mirror-like reflections of Liyu mountain and the cotton clouds above make for spectacular photos. Get your final culture fix at the Hualien Creative and Cultural Park. Housed in a former Japanese winery, this collection of contemporary galleries, exhibition halls, boutique shops, teahouses and artist residences showcase cutting-edge Taiwanese art and creativity in a modern factory restoration.

This tour of Taiwan's East Coast showcases the most beautiful locations and remarkable natural sights along one of the world's most spectacular coastlines Explore the impressive gorge and beautiful surrounding farmlands of Fanshuliao Walk the ‘stone stairs' of Shihtiping and visit the fishing harbor of Shihti (eyes peeled for whales and dolphins in the distance!) Relax over tranquil views of the Pacific coastline and discover aboriginal art at Niushan Huting and Baqi Gazebo Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Explore the impressive gorge and beautiful surrounding farmlands of Fanshuliao Explore the impressive gorge and beautiful surrounding farmlands of Fanshuliao Walk the ‘stone stairs' of Shihtiping and visit the fishing harbor of Shihti (eyes peeled for whales and dolphins in the distance!) Walk the ‘stone stairs' of Shihtiping and visit the fishing harbor of Shihti (eyes peeled for whales and dolphins in the distance!) Relax over tranquil views of the Pacific coastline and discover aboriginal art at Niushan Huting and Baqi Gazebo Relax over tranquil views of the Pacific coastline and discover aboriginal art at Niushan Huting and Baqi Gazebo Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Beginning at Fanshuliao Valley, you'll be immediately confronted with the dramatic topography of a hundred-meter gorge cutting through the mountains at this unique canyon. The area is dotted with quaint cottages on riverside farmlands with undulating hill vistas beyond. Shihtiping showcases the best of Taiwan's coastal geology, where sea erosion has smoothed the volcanic rock, forcing it to immerge into layers resembling stone steps. Stop by the beautifully constructed Taroko Bridge before visiting Shihti Harbor, a working fishing village and the gateway to whale and dolphin sightings in Taiwan – so keep your eyes peeled! The tour ends with two of Taiwan's most tranquil spots: Baqi Gazebo and Niushan Huting. Both provide an undisturbed setting for blissful viewpoints across the Pacific coastline and the coastal mountain range, with lush grasslands dotted with aboriginal sculptures and handicrafts.
strTitle: Beautiful Nature of the East Coast
